etymologies: 1940s: modern Latin, named after Joseph Lister (see Lister, Joseph)

definitions: a type of bacterium which infects humans and other warm-blooded animals through contaminated food.

notes.text: Listeria monocytogenes; motile aerobic Gram-positive rods

shortDefinitions: type of bacterium which infects humans and other warm-blooded animals through contaminated food

definitions: food poisoning or other disease caused by infection with listeria; listeriosis.
shortDefinitions: food poisoning or other disease caused by infection with listeria
